content.description: Between SBR Left and SBR Right
content.location:
Two routes left of tree where Backscratcher starts.

 Route #2 on S.B.R. Block on 2019 guide.

content.description: Right sport route on this face.  Bolted in 2008 by unknown parties.  Originally a Top Roped route, now a clip up.  Enjoy.
content.location:
Rightmost route on this face. Left of Preacher Norm arete 5.10a.

 Route #10 on S.B.R. Block on 2019 guide.

content.description: Climb directly up from the start of Backscratcher to the top.
content.location:
Start left of the tree.

 Route #3 on S.B.R. Block on 2019 guide.

Left most route on S.B.R. Block

 Route #1 on S.B.R. Block on 2019 guide.

content.description: Start just right of the low roof off of the ground. Climb up and move left to the clean steep face. Climb the face and arete to the top.  As per SWPACC Guide - Must have 24" slings to lower off.
content.location:
Sport climb on the right side of the chimney. Across from Tip & Tap.

 Route #11 on S.B.R. Block on 2019 guide.

Located in center of wall between Backscratcher Direct and Hang on St. Christopher.

 Route #6 on S.B.R. Block on 2019 guide.

content.description: Climb directly up to the roof. Pull the overhang on the left side and finish on the thin face above.  Originally graded 10b, consensus is that this is a 5.11.
content.location: Far right end of the S.B.R. Block. Route #12 on S.B.R. Block on 2019 guide.

content.description: Start just left of arete.  Climb up using slopers, etc following the line of 3 bolts.  Avoid starting around the corner on Who needs pro 5.4 trad.  This seriously downgrades the route to about 5.7.  Finish at Metolius Shuts.
content.location: Bolt line on the arete (second bolt line right of the tree in front of Backscratcher)Route #7 on S.B.R. Block on 2019 guide.
Directly to the right of  Hang on St. Christopher, you can climb a much easier variation while reaching far left to clip the bolts on the proper route.  Route #8 on S.B.R. Block on 2019 guide.

content.description: Begin directly under the Backscratcher flake and boulder the face to the flake before finishing on easier terrain.
content.protection: Top Rope, or high boulder problem into the flake which can then be protected to the top.
content.location: Directly right of Backscratcher. Route #5 on S.B.R. Block on 2019 guide.

content.description: Reachy start for shorter people (stack some rocks). Easier climbing once established on climb. A very popular Lost Crag route. This route was originally give a 5.4 rating but consensus is that it is at least a few grades harder.
content.location:
Center of face.

 Route #9 on S.B.R. Block on 2019 guide.

content.description: Start left side of the tree. Move right getting marginal gear. Squeeze between the tree and the rock through the crux moves and gain the wide flake on the right of the tree. Fun gear placements. Finish at anchors.
content.protection: Watch for ground fall and the tree is off limits. Route #4 on S.B.R. Block on 2019 guide.
content.location: Look for the big tree.  start left of tree.

content.description: There's a number of moderate climbs on this block.  This is one of the most popular blocks at the Lost Crag.
